page.title: 12THE MANOR HOUSE
page.content: Michael Martin said that the Manor at one time was bigger than the town of Bridgwater.He did not know how many rooms there were years ago.Many parts of the Manor and around it are historic,for instance they have a dovecot which was used for sending birds away to eat other peoples crops and at night they would come back and be used for pie.Michael Martin has electricity by an underground line thatnruns from Durleigh Elms.He gets his heating by pipes that contain running hot water under the floor.When he first moved in he faced many problems like deathwatch beetles woodworms as well as brambles growing through the walls.It tookfour years to restore the Manor House.Lichen grows very quickly so they merged in the new concrete with the old.The two towers around the back were quite a
